Prada was first established in 1913 by the Italian brothers Mario and Martino Prada. Their shop that's situated in Milan, Italia initially specialized in natural leather goods and imported Native english speakers steamer trunks and shopping bags. Since then, Prada has grown to include other luxury items which include ready-to-wear clothes, leather accessories, shoes, luggage and baseball hat. Despite its largely feminine clientele, the original founder Mario Prada do not believe that women ought to be involved in running the market. Hence, he prevented female relations from engaging in business. His son, however, had no involvement in taking over the family business. In an ironic twist of fate, Prada was eventually bought out by his daughter, Luisia Prada. After Luisia Prada, her daughter Miuccia Prada took in the business in the 1970s and further established the brand as the status symbol it is usually today.

Prada handbags are recognized for its classy black nylon bags which carries the company's inside-out triangle logo. The elegant handbags are often toted by fashionistas belonging to the higher echelon in your society.
